result.execSummary:
The defendant Latanya L. Riley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ro Revoke Deferred Entry of Judgment of Counts 2 & 3 - stj
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
DEOJ agreement

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 10:30 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Desiree Toldt. Defendant appears in person with Attorney Julie Sawyer. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief filed.
State moves to DRI Ct.1- Neglecting a Child & DRI Ct.4- Possess Drug Paraphernaila. 
PLEA: Ct.2- Possession of THC>>GUILTY
           Ct.3- Possess Drug Paraphernailia>>GUILTY
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & finding withheld. 
COURT ORDERS: DEOJ for 1 year. CONDITIONS: Shall not obtain any new crimes, notify DA's office & COC of any address change within 48 hours, participate in AODA education groups, maintain absolute sobriety from illegal drugs, participate in day report at ATTIC, write a one page report re: drugs and negative effects on children, complete 25 hours CS, GFE obtain/maintain full time employment, schooling or a combination of both and if not, complete 5 hours CS per week and 10 verifiable job searches per week & comply with all recommendations as set forth by ATTIC. If defendant successfully completes DEOJ, state will move to amend Ct.3 to Disorderly Conduct contrary to 947.01 with a $5.00 fine plus CC and will futher move to dismiss Ct.2.
COURT adopts and signs DEOJ agreement. 
Bond is continued. 
Review Hearing- 04/28/16 at 1:10 p.m. 
Adj: 10:37 a.m.
Plea hearing on May 14, 2015 at 10:15 am.
Status conference on April 27, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Clerk Marisa.

State appears by ADA Mike Puerner for Desiree Toldt; Deft appears in person with Atty Julie Sawyer. 
No agreement at this time. 
Atty Sawyer notes she was recently appointed in this case and notes this matter will likely be resolved and requests status conference. 
COURT advises Atty Sawyer to see JA to set status conference. 
COURT keeps jury trial on at this time for 1 day with 30 jurors to be called in. 
COURT advises parties to file JI and MIL 1 week prior to trial. No other motions are anticipated by the parties.
